body:
## Bug Report
```
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.181 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:97] ["Welcome to TiKV"]
//----------------------empty log!!!---------------
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.182 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:99] [] 
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.182 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:99] ["Release Version:   3.1.0-beta.2"]
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.182 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:99] ["Git Commit Hash:   acd585d8aba82343f094d094a63f16c841ecfe29"]
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.182 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:99] ["Git Commit Branch: HEAD"]
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.182 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:99] ["UTC Build Time:    2020-03-31 06:43:47"]
[2020/04/01 18:04:31.182 +08:00] [INFO] [lib.rs:99] ["Rust Version:      rustc 1.42.0-nightly (0de96d37f 2019-12-19)"]
```
### What version of TiKV are you using?
 Any version

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->
Any system

### Steps to reproduce
just start the tikv

### What did you expect?
The empty log shouldn't exist
### What did happened?
The following logic do not check whether the content is empty before printing the log
```
pub fn log_tikv_info() {
    info!("Welcome to TiKV.");
    for line in tikv_version_info().lines() {
        info!("{}", line);
    }
    info!("");
}
```

labels.name: difficulty/easy

labels.description: Status: Help wanted. Contributions are very welcome!
labels.name: status/help-wanted

title: Empty log after welcome
